title._content: [Reverend W. B. Ball, President of Guadalupe College, Seguin, Texas]

description._content: Title: [Reverend W. B. Ball, President of Guadalupe College, Seguin, Texas] Creator: Halm's Art Studio Date: ca. 1909-1910 Place: Seguin, Guadalupe County, Texas Part Of: Lawrence T. Jones III Texas photography collection DescriptionRev. Dr. William Baton Ball (1839–1923) was a black Civil War veteran, minister, and member of the Guadalupe Baptist Association which founded Guadalupe College in Seguin, Texas. He served eight years as president of the college from 1906-1914 and thirty-seven years as Pastor of the Second Baptist Church of Seguin. This 1909 photograph is a composite of several photographic views taken of Ball during various stages of his life and career. Physical Description: 1 photographic print: gelatin silver; 14 x 9.5 cm. on 18.4 x 13.2 cm. mount File: ag2008_0005_4_4_2_18_c_ball_opt.tif Rights: Please cite Southern Methodist University, Central University Libraries, DeGolyer Library when using this image file. A high-quality version of this file may be obtained for a fee by contacting degolyer@smu.edu. For more information, see: digitalcollections.smu.edu/u?/jtx,312 View the Lawrence T. Jones III Texas Photographs at: digitalcollections.smu.edu/all/cul/jtx/
